column4: Can someone help me to merge partitions? I have a Toshiba laptop that I want to dual boot with Ubuntu. For some reason Toshiba as 3 partitions on the drive. I tried deleting the 2 small partitions and seeing if I could resize the main partition and it's not working.
a dual boot of windows and linux usually has three partitions
windows, linux, and swap
I know but windows is setup with three partitions already
Ubuntu wants to write over Vista
boot with the ubuntu livecd and use gparted to modify your disk
be thoughtful of which partitions you edit, as youll likely lose data in the process
that's what I want to know.. How do I do that with 3 partitions already on the disk?
they have a 1.5gb and a 7 gb partion that I'mt rying to delete
the 1.5 gb is before the vista partition, and the 7 gb is after. I deleted both partitions and have unallocated space that I can't seem to do anything with
gparted will allow you to move partitions on the disk
I'm going to boot in to live CD right now.
I clicked on the vista drive and clicked on Resize/ Move. I moved the slider all the way over and clicked on apply. I keep getting an error occurred while applying operations
even thought it's unallocated space?
just use that small 1.5g space at the start as your swap space
I tried that. another thing I'm noticing is that the ntfs drive has a yellow triangle with an exclamation point
my ntfs drive has the same icon
ok
even when I clicked on "Check" for the ntfs partition I get an error
i dont know what to say about that, i cant even try the check command on mine, its greyed out
I figured out the problem with the partitions on my hard drive. I ran chkdsk and the disk had errors. I am now able to resize the partition
glad to hear youve gotten it figured out
thanks for your help before
